radiographic_examinations.findings: Small bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent atelectasis in the lower lobes bilaterally; cylindrical-shaped density in the anterior abdominal wall at the subcostal level on the right at the site of surgery, possibly a postoperative hematoma; high-density in the gallbladder bed region, likely a postoperative hematoma; marked inflammatory stranding centered around the pancreas consistent with previously documented findings; no evidence of pancreatic necrosis or hemorrhage; kidneys appear normal; nonspecific perinephric fat stranding; no evidence of retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The degree of inflammatory changes appears to have increased since previous study.
